definitions.title: n.pr.m.
definitions.body: (LXX Zhgwr, A Zwa, LXXL Adramelec to\n Ai)qi/opa to\n katoikou=nta e)/ Ai)gu/ptw| (!); Jos:Ant. ix. 14, 1 Zwan; Vulgate Sua; all acc.), called [[מֶלֶח מִחְרַיִם]] 2Ki 17:4, with whom Hoshea had intrigue; poss.= Šab-’-ê, or Sib-’-ê mentioned by Sargon (KB:ii.54.1.25.26 COT:ad loc.) as a ruler (appar.) under Pir’u king of Muṣuri; hence Schr:COT l. c. prop. to rd. [[סֶוֶא]], and, further, identify. Šab-’-ê = [[סֶוֶא]] with Sûabaku, founder of 25th (Ethiop.) dynasty, cf. Wied:Äg. Gesch. 583 f.; very uncertain is Wkl's conj. of [[סוא]] = Sib-’-ê as general of kg. Pir’u of Muṣri in N Arab. (Wkl:MVG 1898, 3 ff.).
